skill.name: slack-gif-creator
skill.description: Knowledge and utilities for creating animated GIFs optimized for Slack. Provides constraints, validation tools, and animation concepts. Use when users request animated GIFs for Slack like "make me a GIF of X doing Y for Slack."
skill.summary: Knowledge and utilities for creating animated GIFs optimized for Slack. Provides constraints, valida...
skill.author: Azeem-2

security_audit.summary: This is a pure image processing skill with no network access, no external commands, and no code execution risks. All operations are local file I/O for GIF creation and validation using standard Python libraries (Pillow, imageio, numpy).

content.value_statement: Users struggle to create properly sized GIFs for Slack reactions and messages. This skill provides tools to build optimized GIFs with animation utilities, easing functions, and validation to meet Slack requirements.
actual_capabilities: Build GIFs from frames using GIFBuilder class with PIL Images
Validate GIF dimensions and file size against Slack requirements
Apply easing functions for smooth natural motion animations
Create frames with gradient backgrounds, shapes, text, and stars
Optimize GIFs for emoji size (128x128) with color reduction
Deduplicate similar frames to reduce file size
limitations: Does not include pre-made animation templates or graphics library
Does not support emoji font rendering (unreliable across platforms)
Does not provide video to GIF conversion functionality
Requires user to write animation logic using PIL primitives

use_cases.title: Custom reaction GIFs
use_cases.description: Create custom emoji-sized GIFs for team reactions and celebrations.

use_cases.title: Animated announcements
use_cases.description: Design message-sized animated GIFs for channel announcements.

use_cases.title: Visual feedback
use_cases.description: Create quick animated responses for code reviews and team communication.

prompt_templates.title: Basic emoji GIF
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a bouncing ball GIF at 128x128 pixels for Slack emoji. Use 10 frames and save as emoji.gif.

prompt_templates.title: Animated icon
prompt_templates.prompt: Make a pulsing star animation. Use ease_out easing, 12 frames, and save with 48 colors.

prompt_templates.title: Particle effect
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an explosion particle burst animation with fading particles. Use back_out easing for motion.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-effect GIF
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a spinning and bouncing combined animation. Use 20 frames, validate for Slack message size, and optimize colors.

output_examples.input: Create a bouncing ball GIF for Slack emoji
output: GIF created: emoji.gif (128x128, 12 frames @ 10 fps, 0.6s duration, 48 colors)
Ready for Slack emoji use - dimensions are optimal (128x128)

best_practices: Use 128x128 pixels with 48 colors for emoji GIFs to meet Slack requirements
Apply easing functions like ease_out or bounce_out for natural motion
Validate output with is_slack_ready() before sharing in Slack
anti_patterns: Using linear easing for all animations (looks robotic)
Exceeding 128x128 for emoji GIFs (rejected by Slack)
Saving without color optimization results in large file sizes

faq.question: What dimensions should I use for Slack emoji?
faq.answer: Use 128x128 pixels for best results. Acceptable range is 64-128 pixels square.

faq.question: How many colors should my GIF use?
faq.answer: Use 48 colors for emoji GIFs and 128 colors for message GIFs. More colors increase file size.

faq.question: Can I use this with video files?
faq.answer: No, this skill creates GIFs from programmatic frames. Use video-to-GIF tools separately for video conversion.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, all processing is local. No data leaves your machine. Only reads and writes files you specify.

faq.question: Why does my GIF look choppy?
faq.answer: Try higher FPS (15-20) or apply easing functions. Linear motion appears jerky; use ease_out for natural deceleration.

faq.question: How does this compare to online GIF makers?
faq.answer: This tool provides programmatic control and Slack optimization. Online tools offer templates but less customization.
